greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A(n,k) is the number of moduli m such that the multiplicative order of k mod m equals n; square array A(n,k), n>=1, k>=1, read by antidiagonals.
formula: A(n,k) = |{m : multiplicative order of k mod m = n}|.
A(n,k) = Sum_{d|n} mu(n/d)*tau(k^d-1), mu = A008683, tau = A000005.
mathematica: a[n_, k_] := Sum[ MoebiusMu[n/d] * DivisorSigma[0, k^d - 1], {d, Divisors[n]}]; a[1, 1] = 0; Table[ a[n - k + 1, k], {n, 1, 12}, {k, n, 1, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 12 2012 *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jun 01 2012
